1.title: Ukraine says ceasefire at MH17 crash site still in force
1.text:
Ukraine's government said on Friday, Aug. 8 the ceasefire with separatist rebels at the crash site of Malaysian airliner MH17 was still in force despite an announcement that it would be suspended until recovery work there resumed.

On July 19, the Kyiv Post observed several militants using an emergency services vehicle from Khartsysk to transport armed fighters to the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 crash site in Hrabove, Donetsk Oblast. © Christopher J. Miller

Web links to Kyiv Post material are allowed provided that they contain a URL hyperlink to the www.kyivpost.com material and a maximum 500-character extract of the story. 4.title: Russian-backed separatists requisition ambulances in eastern Ukraine ‘to transport fighters’
4.text:
Since 1995, the Kyiv Post has been the world's window on Ukraine. Please support the newspaper’s quality, independent journalism with a digital subscription. Subscribers receive unlimited access to all stories, archives and PDFs from the Kyiv Post's staff writers and news services. More info.

Kremlin-backed militants in eastern Ukraine have threatened medical staff, stolen and destroyed medical equipment, and requisitioned emergency vehicles to transport fighters, according to a Human Rights Watch report set to be released on Aug. 5.

On July 19, the Kyiv Post observed several militants using an emergency services vehicle from Khartsysk to transport armed fighters to the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 crash site in Hrabove, Donetsk Oblast. At least five men with face masks and automatic rifles exited the vehicle upon arriving at the scene. © Christopher J. Miller

Web links to Kyiv Post material are allowed provided that they contain a URL hyperlink to the www.kyivpost.com material and a maximum 500-character extract of the story. Otherwise, all materials contained on this site are protected by copyright law and may not be reproduced without the prior written permission of Public Media at news@kyivpost.com
